data.title: An Old Standby for BBQ
data.text: This is a an above average barbecue place.  They support the local teachers every year, and I was using my coupon.  I had the hot sausage and sliced brisket.  It is almost perfect.  It is hard for a chain to compete with the small superstar barbecue places.

data.title: Decent barbecue, but outstanding yeast rolls.
data.text:
Spring Creek is a chain barbecue establishment that serves decent barbecue.  The ribs appear to be pre-cooked because they lather them with sauce and throw them on a hot griddle to reheat them.  The other meats are adequate.  I prefer the burnt edges of the brisket and find it is very tender and juicy.

The main reason to go there - FRESH, HOT, YEAST ROLLS!

The sides are probably purchased from a food wholesaler which, in my opinion, makes them mediocre.  Nothing tastes fresh, except the rolls.  Prices are reasonable $-$$.

If you visit at lunch on Sundays you'll hear wonderful Gospel Music over their speaker system and get a scoop of Blue Bell's Homemade Vanilla Ice Cream for dessert.  The best part about that is - IT'S FREE!

data.title: Favorite Texas BBQ
data.text: Spring Creek BBQ is always a favorite place for eating as a family. Also love to treat out of town guests here. ONe is captured by the great smell the moment you enter the restaurant.  I also love the coupons we get in the mail that gives you a free meal when you buy one.  Love it. Love it. Love it!

data.title: Great BBQ & Baked Potatoes
data.text: Great place to dine with the family. We love the fall off the bone tender ribs, the smoked turkey has great flavor and is really juicy. The stuffed baked potato is really good. The potatoes are a good size. Great service always.

data.title: Good bbq
data.text: We really like this place. Help yourself sides and wonderful hot rolls brought by your tale. Great ribs.

data.title: Better than your average chain BBQ
data.text: I always get the two meat platter with beef and ham. Both are very tender and tasty. Large assortment of sides, pickles, onions and peppers. The rolls are freshly baked and are offered by the staff as they bring the basket table to table. There is a large side room which you can reserve for large groups. I like the cafeteria style serving line because you can see what you available for sides.

data.title: Great food and service
data.text: This place always has very good food. Diners are given a choice between "regular" and spice sauce. The staff is always friendly and helpful.

data.title: Great food! Great service!
data.text:
Favorite place to get BBQ. brisket is amazing! And their sides are so yummy. 
They asking do a lot of work with the schools which I love! 
Great staff that's friendly and always says hello when you walk in!

data.title: Great BBQ
data.text: I def recommend spring creek bbq. The place is awesome. We went there with a group of my friends. It was about 17 of us. This place was able to accommodate all of us. The food was great. I had a full slab of ribs with Mac and cheese potato salad and bread. The sides were all you can eat and they kept the bread flowing. All n all a great time great food with great friends!!! I definitely will return when I'm back in Texas!!!!

data.title: A good place for BBQ
data.text:
We went there for lunch on 12-30-2014. The first thing we noticed was the friendly staff. All were top notch. The food was very good, we both had chopped beef sandwich plates. I had mine with potato salad and cole slaw, my wife had okra and potato salad. The price was 9.95 per plate, not bad when you consider the price of beef these days.There was enough food to get a take out box for supper. We are blessed in this area with very good BBQ, and here is just one more reason. 
Try it, I think you will like it.The one negative was the volume of the music. It was hard to communicate.

data.title: Better than average BBQ
data.text:
Spring Creek is far better than other chain BBQ restaurants in the area. It's not the atmosphere or service, it's the meat. Almost everything is juicy and flavorful. The sides are what you expect from a BBQ restaurant--nothing special here. But the hot rolls are to die for and they keep them coming piping hot out of the oven. 

For people in the McKinney/Fairview area, Hutchins BBQ is still by far the best, but Spring Creek beats the heck out of most chains like Dickies which has become a poor excuse for food.

data.title: YUM YUM
data.text:
Great ribs and other BBQ.  Our large church group (20 + folks)  are
always well taken care of...of course they give you the delicious bread (worth the trip in itself) but on Sunday they even give you a dish of BlueBell Ice Cream.  What more could you ask for?

data.title: BBQ
data.text: We have eaten here many times. Great BBQ and love their bread!!!!!! Would recommend it to families or singles. Nice atmosphere.

data.title: Awesome bbq
data.text:
Locals had recommended Spring Creek. Yes it's an outlot in a busy shopping center but we're used to those terrible layouts at home too. We had chicken and ribs. You may have the meat plain or with a variety of sauces. Portions were sizeable and delicious. You can have as many sides as you wish and come back for more. Mini loaves of bread were warm & fresh. Staff was extra friendly, helpful, and attentive offering additional bread and take-away containers. Would definitely recommend.

The only odd thing is that it is not a sit-down and order off the menu restaurant. You get a cafeteria tray, get your food, and then seat yourself. Dessert is from a different order area. That funky setup is what keeps me from giving Spring Creek 5 stars.

data.title: Not good food
data.text:
The staff was fairly friendly and polite. They were the best part about the visit, because they treated us so kindly. The food was very pricy for the portion sizes we got. I really did not like the taste of any of the chicken, brisket, or sides we got. I was very disappointed in the food and have not returned since. 

By the way, who set up this parking lot/shopping center? It is like a maze to get to this place.

data.title: Great Barbeque Place
data.text: The employees were friendly & knew how to treat their customers. Food delicious! It was a clean place to eat.

data.title: Ups and downs
data.text:
Positives - Friendly and polite staff; clean facilities
Negatives - A challenge to reach; average meat and bland sides

In our experience, Spring Creek Barbecue restaurants have been a safe mealtime choice in the north Texas area. Every location we've visited has been well-maintained, staff members have welcomed us, and food has been dependably good.

This location is not quite on par with others. The staff was very friendly, and facilities were among the cleanest we've seen, but with a few exceptions the food was average.

Getting there -

We saw the Spring Creek sign while driving southbound on US 75...too late to switch lanes on the congested thoroughfare. However, we really wanted to eat at this restaurant, so we continued several miles south to the next exit, backtracked to US 380, then worked our way through retail parking lots. The time was about 7:00 p.m., well after sunset in January, and the glare of lights made navigating road construction difficult.

Local residents probably don't have this kind of trouble getting there, but travelers could experience difficulty like we did.

Outside/Inside -

The facility is exceptionally well-maintained. The parking lot and exterior were well lighted. We saw no trash on the pavement or in landscaping. The interior, from the serving area to the dining room to bathrooms, was also in outstanding condition. Floors, glass and tabletops were smudge-free. The restroom was well-stocked and clean.

Superior service -

Line workers had great "counterside" manner. They made us feel special with their warm greeting and attentive service. In typical Spring Creek fashion, they sang ad lib songs about the type of meat we ordered, and were amused when we contributed a chorus to their tune. We felt our patronage was appreciated.

A server came by our table twice to offer freshly-baked rolls. She was very nice when we accepted the first time, and equally nice when we refused the second. When asked for a take-away box, the staff responded kindly and quickly. 

Overall, I'd rate service here in the top 10% of places we've ever eaten.

Food findings -

My wife and I both ordered smoked turkey, but chose different sides. Portions were generous...I had leftover turkey and rolls for lunch twice the week after our visit.

The turkey was alright...not the best we've had, but far from the worst. Their fresh rolls were excellent. Other food items varied from good to below average. 

Macaroni and cheese scored highly, as did the pinto beans. Conversely, the green beans, despite all the bacon in them, had little flavor. The corn cob also lacked luster. My wife speculated it'd been sitting in water too long. Both beans and corn would benefit from additional seasoning. 

The Bottom Line -

I wanted to rate this restaurant higher because they did many things well. Their service is top-notch, a real plus. The building is clean and comfortable. However, food taste and consistency are lacking...and food is the primary reason people go to a restaurant.

With a little work, their food quality can match that of other Spring Creek locations. I hope they make the effort to improve. We'd enjoy eating here again if they do.

data.title: Great ribs
data.text: The ribs are worth the trip to this BBQ local chain. Other items are okay but the ribs stand out. The rolls that they bring to your table are in a word - Wonderful!! Sunday equals a free dish of Blue Bell vanilla ice cream after your meal.

data.title: Not Good Food
data.text: I want this place to be good because it so close to my home, but alas it's really not. Before knowing I planned a casual wedding rehearsal dinner here and had the private back room for our group of 30.  I have no complaints about the service and management, which is great, but the BBQ is just not tasty. The warm rolls were the only high point of the meal.

data.title: An early dinner
data.text: We arrived around 5:30 PM.  I thought it was pretty good.  Better than Randy Whites BBQ.  The ribs were moist and succulent and their sauce is awesome.   It's "all you can eat" so you won't leave this place hungry.
